text: Psalm 23
Yahweh the Shepherd
A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 23 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Yahweh is my shepherd;
I will not lack \add for anything\add*.
In grassy pastures he makes me lie down;
by quiet waters he leads me.
He restores my life.\f + \fr 23:3 \ft Or “my soul” \f*
He leads me in ⸤correct paths⸥\f + \fr 23:3 \ft Literally “paths of righteousness” \f*
for the sake of his name.
Even when I walk in a dark valley, I fear no evil
because you \add are\add* with me.
Your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
You prepare before me a table
in the presence of my oppressors.
You anoint my head with oil;
my cup \add is\add* overflowing.
Surely goodness and loyal love will pursue me
all the days of my life,
and I will stay\f + \fr 23:6 \ft Hebrew “return” \f* in the house\f + \fr 23:6 \ft Or “temple” \f* of Yahweh
⸤for a very long time⸥.\f + \fr 23:6 \ft Literally “for length of days” \f*
